undefined.err_msg: Could not find tool with id 'null'.

inputs.name: identifier_column
inputs.label: Identifier column
inputs.help: The column that will be used to join the input datasets

inputs.name: has_header
inputs.label: Number of header lines in each input file
inputs.help: If this is set to 0, a header line will be added containing column names as follows: the identifier column will be named #KEY and the other columns are named by the input dataset names/columns. If you have one or more header lines in your input, set this to the number of header lines.

inputs.name: old_col_in_header
inputs.label: Add column name to header
inputs.help: Disable if you want column headers to only be composed of the input file names, for example, if you want headers like file1 and not file1_column1, see Help section below. Default: Yes

inputs.name: fill_char
inputs.label: Fill character
inputs.help: a placeholder for empty cells

inputs.name: index
inputs.label: Element index:
inputs.help: Starting from 0

test_param.name: which_dataset
test_param.label: How should a dataset be selected?

toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/repos/bgruening/t.name: Sort
toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/repos/bgruening/t.description: data in ascending or descending order

inputs.name: header
inputs.label: Number of header lines
inputs.help: These will be ignored during sort.

inputs.name: unique
inputs.label: Output unique values
inputs.help: Print only unique values, based on sorted key columns. See help section for details. (--unique)

inputs.name: ignore_case
inputs.label: Ignore case
inputs.help: Sort and Join key column values regardless of upper/lower case letters. (-i)

toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/repos/iuc/annotat.name: annotateMyIDs
toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/repos/iuc/annotat.description: annotate a generic set of identifiers

inputs.name: id_file
inputs.label: File with IDs
inputs.help: A tabular file with the first column containing one of the supported types of identifier, see Help below.

inputs.name: file_has_header
inputs.label: File has header?
inputs.help: If this option is set to Yes, the tool will assume that the input file has a column header in the first row and the identifers commence on the second line. Default: No

inputs.name: organism
inputs.label: Organism
inputs.help: Select the organism the identifiers are from

inputs.name: id_type
inputs.label: ID Type
inputs.help: Select the type of IDs in your input file

inputs.name: output_cols
inputs.label: Output columns
inputs.help: Choose the columns you want in the output table. Note that selecting some columns such as GO or KEGG could make the table very large as some genes may be associated with many terms. Default: ENSEMBL, ENTREZID, SYMBOL, GENENAME

inputs.name: remove_dups
inputs.label: Remove duplicates?
inputs.help: If this option is set to Yes, only the first occurrence of each input Gene ID will be kept. Default: No

inputs.name: rscriptOpt
inputs.label: Output Rscript?
inputs.help: If this option is set to Yes, the Rscript used to annotate the IDs will be provided as a text file in the output. Default: No

inputs.name: find_pattern
inputs.label: Find pattern
inputs.help: Use simple text, or a valid regular expression (without backslashes // )

inputs.name: replace_pattern
inputs.label: Replace with:
inputs.help: Use simple text, or & (ampersand) and \\1 \\2 \\3 to refer to matched text. See examples below.

toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/repos/iuc/limma_v.name: limma
toolshed.g2.bx.psu.edu/repos/iuc/limma_v.description: Perform differential expression with limma-voom or limma-trend

inputs.name: weightOption
inputs.label: Apply voom with sample quality weights?
inputs.help: Apply weights if outliers are present (voomWithQualityWeights). Default: False.

inputs.name: prior_count
inputs.label: Prior count
inputs.help: Average count to be added to each observation to avoid taking log of zero. Default: 3.

test_param.name: de_select
test_param.label: Differential Expression Method
test_param.help: Select the limma-voom or limma-trend method. See Help section below for more information. Default: limma-voom

inputs.name: factorName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: Name of experiment factor of interest (e.g. Genotype). One factor must be entered and there must be two or more groups per factor. Optional additional factors (e.g. Batch) can be entered using the Insert Factor button below, see Help section for more information. NOTE: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores.

inputs.name: groupName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: Name of group that the counts files belong to (e.g. WT or Mut). NOTE: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores (case sensitive).

inputs.name: factorName
inputs.label: Factor Name
inputs.help: Name of experiment factor of interest (e.g. Genotype). One factor must be entered and there must be two or more groups per factor. Additional factors (e.g. Batch) can be entered using the Insert Factor button below, see Help section below. NOTE: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores.

inputs.name: groupNames
inputs.label: Groups
inputs.help: Enter the group names for the samples separated with commas e.g. WT,WT,WT,Mut,Mut,Mut. The order of the names must match the order of the samples in the columns of the count matrix. NOTE: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores (case sensitive), the group names MUST not contain hyphens.

test_param.name: ffile
test_param.label: Input factor information from file?
test_param.help: You can choose to input the factor and group information for the samples from a file or manually enter below. NOTE: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores (case sensitive), the group names MUST not contain hyphens.

test_param.name: format
test_param.label: Count Files or Matrix?
test_param.help: You can choose to input either separate count files (one per sample) or a single count matrix

test_param.name: annoOpt
test_param.label: Use Gene Annotations?
test_param.help: If you provide an annotation file, annotations will be added to the table(s) of differential expression results to provide descriptions for each gene, and used to label the top genes in the Volcano plot. Interactive Glimma Volcano and MD plots will also be generated. See Help section below.

inputs.name: contrast
inputs.label: Contrast of Interest
inputs.help: Names of two groups to compare separated by a hyphen e.g. Mut-WT. If the order is Mut-WT the fold changes in the results will be up/down in Mut relative to WT. If you have more than one contrast enter each separately using the Insert Contrast button below. For differences between contrasts use e.g. (Mut1-Ctrl1)-(Mut2-Ctrl2). For more info, see Chapter 8 in the limma User's guide: https://www.bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/vignettes/limma/inst/doc/usersguide.pdf

test_param.name: cfile
test_param.label: Input Contrast information from file?
test_param.help: You can choose to input the contrast information for the samples from a file or manually enter below. NOTE: Please only use letters, numbers or underscores (case sensitive), the group names MUST not contain hyphens. Use a hyphen to separate the groups you want to compare, as shown in the Help section below.

inputs.name: cpmReq
inputs.label: Minimum CPM
inputs.help: Treat genes with CPM below this value as unexpressed and filter out. See the Filter Low Counts section below for more information.

inputs.name: cpmSampleReq
inputs.label: Minimum Samples
inputs.help: Filter out all genes that do not meet the Minimum CPM in at least this many samples. See the Filter Low Counts section below for more information.

inputs.name: cntReq
inputs.label: Minimum Count
inputs.help: Filter out all genes that do not meet this minimum count. You can choose below to apply this filter to the total count for all samples or specify the number of samples under Minimum Samples. See the Filter Low Counts section below for more information.

inputs.name: cntSampleReq
inputs.label: Minimum Samples
inputs.help: Filter out all genes that do not meet the Minimum Count in at least this many samples. See the Filter Low Counts section below for more information.

test_param.name: count_select
test_param.label: Filter on Total Count or per Sample Count values?

test_param.name: format_select
test_param.label: Filter on CPM or Count values?
test_param.help: It is slightly better to base the filtering on count-per-million (CPM) rather than the raw count values so as to avoid favoring genes expressed in samples sequenced to a higher depth.

test_param.name: filt_select
test_param.label: Filter lowly expressed genes?
test_param.help: Treat genes with very low expression as unexpressed and filter out. See the Filter Low Counts section below for more information. Default: No

inputs.name: plots
inputs.label: Additional Plots
inputs.help: Select additional plots to output in the report

inputs.name: filtCounts
inputs.label: Output Filtered Counts Table?
inputs.help: Output a file containing the raw filtered counts if Filter Low Counts is selected. Default: No

inputs.name: normCounts
inputs.label: Output Normalised Counts Table?
inputs.help: Output a file containing the normalised counts, these are in log2 counts per million (logCPM). Default: No

inputs.name: libinfo
inputs.label: Output Library information file?
inputs.help: Output a tabular file showing the library sizes, normalisation factors and effective library sizes for the samples. Default: No

inputs.name: rscript
inputs.label: Output Rscript?
inputs.help: If this option is set to Yes, the Rscript used will be provided as a text file in the output. Default: No

inputs.name: rdaOption
inputs.label: Output RData file?
inputs.help: Output all the data used by R to construct the plots and tables, can be loaded into R. A link to the RData file will be provided in the HTML report. Default: No

inputs.name: lfc
inputs.label: Minimum Log2 Fold Change
inputs.help: Genes above this threshold and below the p-value threshold are considered significant and highlighted in the MD plot. Default: 0.

inputs.name: pVal
inputs.label: P-Value Adjusted Threshold
inputs.help: Genes below this threshold are considered significant and highlighted in the MD plot. If either BH(1995) or BY(2001) are selected then this value is a false-discovery-rate control. If Holm(1979) is selected then this is an adjusted p-value for family-wise error rate. Default: 0.05.

inputs.name: pAdjust
inputs.label: P-Value Adjustment Method
inputs.help: Default: BH

inputs.name: treat
inputs.label: Test significance relative to a fold-change threshold (TREAT)
inputs.help: If you want to apply a cut-off on a fold change the TREAT function can be used, see Help section below. Default: No

inputs.name: topgenes
inputs.label: Number of genes to highlight in Volcano plot, Heatmap and Stripcharts
inputs.help: The top DE genes will be highlighted in the Volcano plot for each contrast and can be output in heatmap and stripchart PDFs (max 100). Default: 10.

inputs.name: normalisationOption
inputs.label: Normalisation Method
inputs.help: Default: TMM

inputs.name: robOption
inputs.label: Use Robust Settings?
inputs.help: Using robust settings is usually recommended to protect against outlier genes. Default: Yes

join1.name: Join two Datasets
join1.description: side by side on a specified field

inputs.name: unmatched
inputs.label: Keep lines of first input that do not join with second input

inputs.name: partial
inputs.label: Keep lines of first input that are incomplete

inputs.name: input
inputs.label: as a new column to
inputs.help: Dataset missing? See TIP below

test_param.name: header_lines_select
test_param.label: Skip a header line
test_param.help: # characters are already considered as comments and kept

inputs.name: avoid_scientific_notation
inputs.label: Avoid scientific notation
inputs.help: If yes, use fully expanded decimal representation when writing new columns (use only if expression produces decimal numbers).

inputs.name: infile
inputs.label: File to scan for unique values

inputs.name: ignore_case
inputs.label: Ignore differences in case when comparing

inputs.name: column_start
inputs.label: Column start
inputs.help: Unique on specific column range

inputs.name: column_end
inputs.label: Column end
inputs.help: Unique on specific column range

inputs.name: dge_file
inputs.label: Differentially expressed genes file
inputs.help: A tabular file with Gene IDs in the first column, and True or False in the second column. True means a gene is differentially expressed. See Help section for details.

inputs.name: length_file
inputs.label: Gene lengths file
inputs.help: You can calculate the gene lengths using featureCounts or the Gene length and GC content tool.

inputs.name: gene_id
inputs.label: Select Gene ID format
inputs.help: Supported Gene IDs to automatically fetch categories should either be Entrez, Ensembl, or gene symbols.

inputs.name: fetchcats
inputs.label: Select one or more categories
inputs.help: By default, goseq tests all three major Gene Ontology branches; Cellular Component, Biological Process and Molecular Function. However, it is possible to limit testing to any combination and/or to also use KEGG pathways.

test_param.name: catSource
test_param.label: Gene categories
test_param.help: You can obtain a mapping of genes to categories (for some genomes only) or you can provide your own category file.
options: Use a category file from history

inputs.name: wallenius
inputs.label: Use Wallenius method
inputs.help: See help for details

inputs.name: hypergeometric
inputs.label: Use Hypergeometric method
inputs.help: Does not use gene length information. See help for details

inputs.name: repcnt
inputs.label: Sampling number
inputs.help: Number of random samples to be calculated when sampling is used. Set to 0 to not do sampling. Larger values take a long time

inputs.name: p_adj_method
inputs.label: Select a method for multiple hypothesis testing correction

inputs.name: use_genes_without_cat
inputs.label: Count genes without any category?
inputs.help: For example, a large number of genes may have no GO term annotated. If this option is set to No, those genes will be ignored in the calculation of p-values. If this option is set to Yes, then these genes will count towards the total number of genes outside the category being tested. This was the default behaviour for version 1.15.1 and earlier

inputs.name: topgo_plot
inputs.label: Output Top GO terms plot?
inputs.help: Output a PDF plot of the Top 10 over-represented GO terms

inputs.name: make_plots
inputs.label: Produce diagnostic plots?
inputs.help: This will produce the length bias (PWF) plot. If both sampling and wallenius methods are selected, it will also produce a plot comparing their p-values. These plots may help you compare the different p-value estimation methods that goseq can use

inputs.name: cat_genes
inputs.label: Extract the DE genes for the categories (GO/KEGG terms)?

inputs.name: rdata_out
inputs.label: Output RData file?
inputs.help: Output all the data used by R to construct the tables and plots, can be loaded into R

outputs.name: wallenius_tab
outputs.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Ranked category list - Wallenius method

outputs.name: sampling_tab
outputs.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Ranked category list - Sampling method

outputs.name: nobias_tab
outputs.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Ranked category list - Hypergeometric method

outputs.name: sample_vs_wallenius_plot
outputs.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Sampling vs Wallenius P-values plot

outputs.name: top_plot
outputs.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Top over-represented GO terms plot

outputs.name: cat_genes_tab
outputs.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: DE genes for categories (GO/KEGG terms)
